TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GRContext extends SkiaSharp.SKObject
.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit GRContext extends SkiaSharp.GRRecordingContext

Docs.summary: Represents an underlying backend 3D API context.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AbandonContext (bool releaseResources = false);
.method public hidebysig instance void AbandonContext(bool releaseResources) cil managed

Docs.param: Use true to indicate that the underlying 3D context is not yet lost and the will cleanup all allocated resources before returning. Using false will ensure that the destructors of the and any of its created resource objects will not make backend 3D API calls.
Docs.summary: Abandons all GPU resources and assumes the underlying backend 3D API context is no longer usable. After returning it will assume that the underlying context may no longer be valid.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
Docs.remarks: Always dispose the object before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the finalizer.

Docs.summary: Call to ensure all drawing to the context has been issued to the underlying 3D API.

Docs.param: to submit the work to the GPU after flushing; otherwise, .
to wait for the GPU to complete the work; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Flushes all pending drawing operations to the underlying 3D API, optionally submitting work to the GPU.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetMaxSurfaceSampleCount (SkiaSharp.SKColorType colorType);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetMaxSurfaceSampleCount(valuetype SkiaSharp.SKColorType colorType) cil managed

Docs.param: The color type.
Docs.summary: Gets the maximum supported sample count for the specified color type.
Docs.returns: Returns the maximum supported sample count.
Docs.remarks: 1 is returned if only non-MSAA rendering is supported for the color type. 0 is returned if rendering to this color type is not supported at all.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetRecommendedSampleCount (SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig config, float dpi);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetRecommendedSampleCount(valuetype SkiaSharp.GRPixelConfig config, float32 dpi) cil managed

Docs.param: The configuration of the render target.
The display density in dots per inch.
Docs.summary: Returns the recommended sample count for a render target when using this context.
Docs.remarks: May return 0 if MSAA is not supported or recommended to be used by default.

MemberSignature.Value: public void ResetContext (SkiaSharp.GRBackendState state = SkiaSharp.GRBackendState.All);
.method public hidebysig instance void ResetContext(valuetype SkiaSharp.GRBackendState state) cil managed

Docs.param: Flags to control what is reset.
Docs.summary: Informs the context that the state was modified and should resend.
Docs.remarks: The context normally assumes that no outsider is setting state within the underlying 3D API's context/device/whatever. This method shouldn't be called frequently for good performance.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetResourceCacheLimit (long maxResourceBytes);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetResourceCacheLimit(int64 maxResourceBytes) cil managed

Docs.param: The maximum number of bytes of video memory that can be held in the cache.
Docs.summary: Specifies the GPU resource cache limit.
Docs.remarks: If the current cache exceeds this limit, it will be purged (LRU) to keep the cache within this limit.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetResourceCacheLimits (int maxResources, long maxResourceBytes);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetResourceCacheLimits(int32 maxResources, int64 maxResourceBytes) cil managed

Docs.param: The maximum number of resources that can be held in the cache.
The maximum number of bytes of video memory that can be held in the cache.
Docs.summary: Specify the GPU resource cache limits.
Docs.remarks: If the current cache exceeds either of these, it will be purged (LRU) to keep the cache within these limits.
